result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A. Schaaf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DEF placed on 1 year probation.  Pay Costs $453.  Pay restitution to Walmart of $815.45.

miscConds.notes: $815.45 restitution to be paid to Walmart.  $816.00 on deposit with the Clerk of Court is being forwarded to DOC per court order to be paid to victim.

$453 costs, including $200 DNA surcharge.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.dispoDesc: State moves to amend count to 943.01(1).  Court approves. DEF pleads No Contest to Amended Ct #1, Found Guilty. Sentence withheld, DEF placed on 1 year probation, Restitution $815.45 to be paid to Walmart.  Costs $453.00.  Forward $816 on deposit to the DOC
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

APPEARANCES: Defendant Matthew A. Schaaf in court.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives right to counsel at this time to try to talk to DA and come to a resolution of this matter.  Court enters NOT GUILTY plea to Counts 1, 2, and 3.  

Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
